definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: The bill was sent to her room.
sentences.chinese: 当医药费通知单送到她的病房时，她不敢看。

sentences.english: That tax bill had the senator's fingerprints all over it.
sentences.chinese: 那张纳税通知单上满是那位参议员的指印。

sentences.english: B: Would you show me your notice?
sentences.chinese: 给我看一下您的通知单。

sentences.english: and march to their door with confidence and hand deliver that notice.
sentences.chinese: 自信地走到他们的门口，把驱逐通知单交给他们。

sentences.english: Please return your stamped Discharge Notice to the Nurse Station.
sentences.chinese: 请您将办妥并盖章之出院通知单缴回护理站。

sentences.english: At last, He finalizes receive interview requisition.
sentences.chinese: 最后，他终于接到面试通知单。

sentences.english: We have a parcel notice from the post office for you.
sentences.chinese: 我们接到了邮局的包裹通知单。

sentences.english: No, you must receive the consumer vouchers at the distribution sites listed on the notification.
sentences.chinese: 不可以，须依领券通知单指定之发放所领取。

sentences.english: According to one notice , it said that she owed the bank $200,00.
sentences.chinese: 按一张通知单所说，她欠这家银行20万美元。

sentences.english: There was a parking ticket under the windshield wiper.
sentences.chinese: 汽车挡风玻璃刮水器下有一张违章停车罚款的通知单。

sentences.english: I'll give you the accommodation advice.
Her brush with cancer changed her dating criteria.
sentences.chinese: 那一纸癌症通知单改变了阿蒂欧丽约会对象的标准。

sentences.english: I got a parcel arrival notice yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我收到了一个包裹通知单。

definition: receipt (written acknowledgement of receipt of an item)
bill of warrant (certificate, allowing one to collect money or valuables)
